result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle A Carter

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/electronic weapons. Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

8:58 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Michelle A Carter appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Justin G Griffis appeared by Zoom for Michelle A Carter. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Griffis is appointed. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

8:40 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Michelle A Carter in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Michelle A Carter. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Griffis is appointed. 

The Court recesses at 08:42 AM for the State to file an amended complaint.
The Court recalls the matter at 08:56 AM with the same appearances.

The State states that they will be filing an amended complaint, however may take awhile. 
The Court notes that it is willing to dismiss the case, however the Defendant would not like to have two (2) CCAP entries.
The Court will adjourn the matter for an adjourned initial appearance. 
THE COURT WILL AUTHORIZE ZOOM FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
